item.title: Roguelikes, Shooters, And More: Here Are 46 Games Coming Out In November 2025
item.content:encoded:
The release calendar is finally dying down a bit, but only just barely. November means it’s officially Call of Duty season, but there are tons of games coming out this month that aren’t called Black Ops 7. Switch 2 exclusives (Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment), neat indie RPGs (Demonschool), and overdue PS5 ports (S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2) abound. Here are 46 games releasing this month, complete with descriptions and trailers. We’ll update the list as other interesting games get announced.

Quarantine Zone: The Last Check – November 1

Platforms: PC
Developers: Brigada Games
Publishers: Devolver Digital
Genre: Indie horror sim

Tavern Keeper – November 3

Platforms: PlayStation 5
Developers: Greenheart Games
Publishers: Greenheart Games
Genre: Strategy sim

Europa Universalis V – November 4

Platforms: PC
Developers: Paradox Tinto
Publishers: Paradox Interactive
Genre: Grand strategy resource management

Football Manager 26 – November 4

Platforms: PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PC
Developers: Sports Interactive
Publishers: Sega
Genre: Sports management sim

Age of Empires IV: Anniversary Edition – November 4

Platforms: PlayStation 5
Developers: World’s Edge, Relic Entertainment
Publishers: Xbox Game Studios
Genre: Real-time strategy

1000xResist – November 4

Platforms: PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S
Developers: Sunset Visitor
Publishers: Fellow Traveler
Genre: Sci-fi visual novel adventure

7 Days Blood Moons – November 4

Platforms: PC

Satisfactory – November 4

Platforms: PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S
Developers: Coffee Stain Studios
Publishers: Coffee Stain Publishing
Genre: Factory sim sandbox

Sonic Rumble – November 5

Platforms: PC, iOS, Android
Developers: Sonic Team, Rovio Entertainment
Publishers: Sega
Genre: Battle royale party game

Dead Static Drive – November 5

Platforms: PC
Developers: Reuben Games
Publishers: Reuben Games
Genre: Lovecraftian driving adventure

The Last Caretaker – November 6

Platforms: PC
Developers: Channel37 Ltd
Publishers: Channel37 Ltd
Genre: Open-world survival

UNBEATABLE – November 6

Platforms: PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PC
Developers: D-CELL GAMES
Publishers: Playstack
Genre: Anime rhythm adventure

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment – October 6

Platforms: Switch 2
Developers: Bandai Namco
Publishers: Nintendo
Genre: Hack-and-slash

Egging On – October 6

Platforms: PC
Developers: Egobounds
Publishers: Alibi Games, IndieArk
Genre: Physics platformer

Syberia Remastered – November 6

Platforms: PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Switch, PC
Developers: Virtuallyz Gaming, Microids Studio Paris
Publishers: Microids
Genre: Point-and-click adventure

Tiny Lands 2 – November 6

Platforms: PC
Developers: Hyper Three Studio
Publishers: Hidden Trap, TrueColor Games
Genre: Surreal hidden object point-and-click

Cling to Blindness – November 7

Platforms: PC
Developers: Lizardry
Publishers: Playism
Genre: Survival horror

Thrasher – November 7

Platforms: PC
Developers: Puddle
Publishers: Playism
Genre: Psychedelic arcade game

Voidtrain – November 10

Platforms: Xbox Series X/S, PC
Developers: Nearga
Publishers: HypeTrain Digital
Genre: Co-op open-world survival shooter

Fallout 4: Anniversary Edition – November 10

Platforms: PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PC
Developers: Bethesda Game Studios
Publishers: Bethesda
Genre: Post-apocalyptic RPG shooter

Ambrosia Sky – November 10

Platforms: PC
Developers: Soft Rains
Publishers: Soft Rains
Genre: Sci-fi immersive sim

Goodnight Universe – November 11

Platforms: PC
Developers: Nice Dream
Publishers: Skybound Games
Genre: Cinematic adventure

Lumines Arise – November 11

Platforms: PlayStation 5, PC
Developers: Enhance, Monstars
Publishers: Monstars
Genre: Rhythm puzzle game

Possessor(s) – November 11

Platforms: PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Switch, PC
Developers: Heart Machine Games
Publishers: Devolver Digital
Genre: 2D action platformer

Million Depth – November 12

Platforms: PC
Developers: Cyber Space Biotope
Publishers: Playism
Genre: Side-scrolling action roguelike

Anno 117: Pax Romana – November 13

Platforms: PC
Developers: Ubisoft Mainz
Publishers: Ubisoft
Genre: City-builder

Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero – November 13

Platforms: Switch 2, Switch
Developers: Spike Chunsoft
Publishers: Bandai Namco
Genre: Anime arena fighting game

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road – November 13

Platforms: PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Switch 2, Switch, PC
Developers: Level-5
Publishers: Level-5
Genre: Sports RPG

Yakuza Kiwami 1 & 2 – November 13

Platforms: Switch 2
Developers: Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio
Publishers: Sega
Genre: Horror puzzle platformer adventure

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 – November 14

Platforms: PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, PC
Developers: Treyarch, Raven Software
Publishers: Activision
Genre: Multiplayer military FPS

Monster Hunter Stories 1 & 2 – November 14

Platforms: Xbox Series X/S
Developers: Capcom
Publishers: Capcom
Genre: Turn-based RPG

Videoverse – November 14

Platforms: PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, Switch, PC

Publishers: Kinmoku
Genre: Visual novel

Escape from Tarkov – November 15

Platforms: PC
Developers: Battlestate Games
Publishers: Battlestate Games
Genre: Extraction shooter

Marvel’s Deadpool VR – November 18

Platforms: Oculus Quest 3

Genre: Action

SpongeBob SquarePants: Titans of the Tide – November18

Platforms: PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, Switch 2, PC
Developers: Purple Lamp
Publishers: THQ Nordic
Genre: 3D platformer

Demonschool –  November 19

Platforms: PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, Switch, PC
Developers: Necrosoft Games
Publishers: Ysbyrd Games
Genre: Strategy RPG

Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault – November 19

Platforms: PC
Developers: Digital Sun
Publishers: 11 bit studios
Genre: Dungeon-crawling RPG

Kirby Air Riders – November 20

Platforms: Switch 2
Developers: Nintendo
Publishers: Nintendo
Genre: Racing adventure

Neon Inferno – November 20

Platforms: PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, Switch, PC
Developers: Zenovia Interactive
Publishers: Retroware
Genre: Run-and-gun side-scroller

Outlaws + Handful of Missions: Remaster – November 20

Platforms: PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, Switch, PC
Developers: LucasArts, Nightdive Studios
Publishers: Lucasfilm, Disney, Atari, Nightdive
Genre: Boomer shooter Western

R-Type Delta: HD Boosted – November 20

Platforms: PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X/S, Switch, PC
Developers: City Connection
Publishers: City Connection, Clear River Games
Genre: Shmup

S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl – November 20

Platforms: PlayStation 5
Developers: GSC Game World
Publishers: GSC Game World
Genre: Post-apocalyptic immersive shooter

Prologue: Go Wayback! – November 20

Platforms: PC
Developers: PlayerUnknown Productions
Publishers: PlayerUnknown Productions
Genres: Survival sim

Monsters Are Coming! Rock & Road – November 20

Platforms: PC
Developers: Ludogram
Publishers: Raw Fury
Genres: Tower defense bullet hell roguelike

Terminator 2D: No Fate – November 26

Platforms: PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, Switch, PC

Bubble Bobble: Sugar Dungeons – November 27

item.title: This High-Spec HP Laptop (4TB SSD, 64GB RAM) Is 70% Off and Selling for Pennies, Amazon Clears Final Stock
item.content:encoded:
Laptops with serious power usually carry a price tag equal to a small fortune. You know how it goes: you look at the specs you actually need, check the price, and immediately start compromising. Maybe you don’t really need that much storage, right? Well, HP just threw an early Black Friday sale on Amazon that changes the game completely. This 17.3-inch laptop comes with 64GB of RAM, a 4TB SSD, and an AMD Ryzen 5 processor-basically the kind of setup that normally runs close to $4,000. The good new is that right now, it’s sitting at $1,199 after a 70% discount.

See at Amazon

The 17.3-inch touchscreen gives you breathing room that smaller laptops just can’t match: If you have ever tried to work on a 13-inch screen and felt you were playing Tetris with your windows, you will appreciate the reason size matters in this respect. The HD+ anti-glare panel means you can set up near a window without spending half your day adjusting the angle of the screen so that you can actually see what you’re doing. The touchscreen aspect really does speed things up when scrolling through long documents or just generally navigating about Windows 11 Pro.

Specs That Matter in Real Life

The Ryzen 5 7430U processor runs 6 cores and 12 threads and hits speeds up to 4.3GHz when you need it. In plain English, this means you can video call your team while updating a presentation with Slack pinging in the background and your music playing without your laptop freezing up or fans screaming like a jet engine. The integrated Radeon Graphics handle streaming and everyday visual tasks without breaking a sweat. It’s not a gaming rig, but it covers everything most people actually do on their computers day in and day out.

But here’s where it gets interesting: 64GB of RAM is absurd for most laptops and that is precisely why it’s so great. Most computers ship with 8GB or maybe 16GB, which forces you into this constant dance of closing programs to free up memory. With 64GB, you just stop thinking about it: Keep your email open all week, run that resource-hungry video editing software, open 50 browser tabs for your research project and the laptop just handles it.

The 4TB SSD storage means you are done with that “delete old files to install new programs” routine. Your whole photo collection from the last decade, work projects, personal files, software and backups can all live on one drive. And SSDs load everything faster than old hard drives so your programs open in seconds instead of you watching that spinning wheel for what feels like forever.

In Windows 11 Pro, there is Microsoft Copilot, the AI tool that helps draft emails, summarize long documents, or even brainstorm ideas when you’re stuck. Built-in AI image features let you edit photos without downloading extra software. Windows Hello logs you in via facial recognition which means no more typing passwords every time you open your laptop.

At $1,199 for this configuration, you’re getting a laptop that doesn’t force you to choose between the features you want versus the ones you can afford.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/this-high-spec-hp-laptop-4tb-ssd-64gb-ram-is-70-off-and-selling-for-pennies-amazon-clears-final-stock-2000641026
